title.justification: The title is stated clearly at the beginning of the paper.

extractions.description: The paper introduces Reset Free RL with Intelligently Switching Controller (RISC), a novel reinforcement learning algorithm designed for environments where automatic resets are not available. The paper demonstrates that RISC offers state-of-the-art performance on several challenging reset-free RL environments.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results to validate the effectiveness of the proposed RISC algorithm across various environments.
type.quote: In this section, we empirically analyze the performance of RISC. Specifically, we: (1) Investigate whether reverse curriculums are the best approach for reset-free RL; (2) Compare the performance of RISC to other reset-free methods on the EARL benchmark; (3) Evaluate the necessity of both; timeout-nonterminal bootstrapping and early switching for RISC with an ablation study.

name.justification: The paper focuses on improving reinforcement learning algorithms for environments where episode resets are not feasible.
name.quote: Our current algorithms are designed around the ability to reset the environment, and do not transfer to settings without resets (Co-Reyes et al., 2020).

name.justification: The research addresses challenges in reinforcement learning where automatic environment resets are unavailable.
name.quote: Recent works have started to explore learning in environments where automatic resets are not available in a setting known as reset-free or autonomous RL.

name.value: Reset Free RL with Intelligently Switching Controller (RISC)
name.justification: RISC is the primary model introduced and evaluated in the paper.
name.quote: To that end, we introduce Reset Free RL with Intelligently Switching Controller (RISC).

is_contributed.justification: RISC is a new algorithm proposed by the authors.
is_contributed.quote: To that end, we introduce Reset Free RL with Intelligently Switching Controller (RISC).

is_executed.justification: RISC is evaluated experimentally in various environments.
is_executed.quote: In this section, we empirically analyze the performance of RISC.

is_compared.justification: The performance of RISC is compared to several other reset-free RL methods.
is_compared.quote: Figures 4 and 5 show the results of RISC on the EARL benchmark environments compared to previously published results.

referenced_paper_title.justification: RISC is a novel contribution of the paper and does not reference an existing paper for its definition.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To that end, we introduce Reset Free RL with Intelligently Switching Controller (RISC).

name.justification: FBRL is mentioned and compared against RISC as a baseline model.
name.quote: A simple approach to learn in this setting is Forward Backward RL (FBRL), which alternates between a forward controller that tries to accomplish the task and a reset controller that tries to recover the initial state distribution (Eysenbach et al., 2017; Han et al., 2015).

is_contributed.justification: The model is not a contribution of the paper but is used for comparison.
